results:
Based on my search results, I found important information about the first Polish translator and edition of "The Little Prince" (Mały Książę) by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry:

The first Polish edition was translated by Marta Malicka and published in 1947 by the publishing cooperative "Płomienie" in Warsaw.

This translation was notably the second translation of The Little Prince in the world. The original first edition appeared in English, followed by the French edition.

Polish was the first language in the world into which The Little Prince was translated (not counting English, in which the book appeared a few days before the French edition). The book appeared from the publishing house Spółdzielnia Wydawnicza Płomienie in Marta Malicka's translation just two years after the end of the war (Warsaw, 1947).

The next translations into German and Italian had to wait another two years. This highlights how quickly and enthusiastically Polish readers embraced this work.

The Little Prince aroused exceptional interest among Polish readers. Evidence of this is not only the fact that more than 20 translators have undertaken to translate the text from French into Polish. The version translated by Jan Szwykowski has the most editions - over 50 (as of 2024).

In summary, the first Polish translator was **Marta Malicka**, and the first Polish edition was published in **1947 in Warsaw by Spółdzielnia Wydawnicza "Płomienie"**, making it remarkably the second translation of the book in the world after English.
